page.title: 05MIXED AGRICULTURE
page.content: {General Information.}Farming is now highly mechanised, therefore there are fewer farm workers. Most workers have a basic five day week with the exception of shepherds who have a seven day contract. With few exceptions workers have a rent free house, but free milk and potatoes are seldom allowed. Fertilizers and insecticides are extensively used on the land. Most farms have some form of drier for hay and grain. Hay is usually formed into oblong bales for general use or larger round bales which are used in circular feeders. Some straw is also formed into round bales which are used for bedding and overwintreing cattle in courts or sheds. The remaining stubble is usually burned off.
